intro: Clibadium psilogynum, commonly known as the silverleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
